column1: 529868C5-FEA2-42B2-94CA-C29D9FE2ECEC#appfire#DE2644C1-2314-44B2-859F-C28DA42718AD#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-01 14:17:11.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-01 14:17:11.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#75F11046-39E5-4429-A55F-B82F124B5F89#appfire#DE2644C1-2314-44B2-859F-C28DA42718AD#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-01 14:17:11.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-01 14:17:11.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#B41648E9-8075-4C98-A3A6-E0EB8CDD7E6B#appfire#DE2644C1-2314-44B2-859F-C28DA42718AD#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-01 14:17:11.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-01 14:17:11.0#appfire#1
